meanings.definition: Deprive (a man) of his male role or identity.
meanings.sent1: Bullying someone can emasculate them and make them feel less like a man.
meanings.sent2: The villain's cruel words and actions emasculated the hero in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: When the tiny chihuahua scared off the big dog, it emasculated him in the eyes of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in the championship game emasculated the star player, shattering his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The king's decision to strip the knight of his title and lands emasculated him in the eyes of the court.

meanings.definition: Make (a person, idea, or piece of legislation) weaker or less effective.
meanings.sent1: Cutting the budget emasculates the project, leaving it unable to achieve its goals.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt officials' actions emasculated the new law, rendering it powerless to bring about change.
meanings.sent3: The leak in the boat's hull emasculated its ability to stay afloat, causing it to sink slowly.
meanings.sent4: The lack of support from key allies emasculated the diplomatic efforts, leading to a failed negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The virus's mutation emasculated the vaccine's effectiveness, leaving many vulnerable to infection.
